title: DA: Teen arrested after threatening to ‘shoot up’ Cape Cod school
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Crime When police searched his residence, the man had a 3D printer capable of making weapons, according to prosecutors.
By Molly Farrar September 14, 2025 | 6:06 PM 2 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
An 18-year-old from Cape Cod is facing charges after he allegedly threatened to “shoot up a school” last month and showed up at an elementary school, officials said.

title: Patriots stock watch: Who stood out and struggled in a wild win against Miami
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots Drake Maye's stock is up after an efficient performance leads to a close divisional win.

Drake Maye AP Photo/Rebecca Blackwell Mike Vrabel’s first win as Patriots head coach came on a bizarre Sunday in Miami that featured back-to-back special teams touchdowns, a late surge by the Patriots’ pass-rush, and flashes of potential from Drake Maye.
The Patriots prevailed 33-27, stealing a divisional win on the road against the Dolphins.

title: Former Patriots coach Jerod Mayo makes appearance at Tennessee football game
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots Mayo has not made many public appearances since his firing.
Jerod Mayo only lasted one season as head coach of the Patriots.
Barry Chin / Globe Staff Former Patriots coach Jerod Mayo attended the Tennessee-Georgia football game on Saturday.

title: 9 takeaways from Patriots’ 33-27 wild win over Dolphins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots Drake Maye was sharp (19-of-23, 3 total TDs) and Rhamondre Stevenson dominated (142 yards) in a wacky game in South Florida.
Drake Maye accounted for three touchdowns in Sunday's win over Miami.

(AP Photo/Rebecca Blackwell) By Conor Ryan September 14, 2025 | 12:17 PM 12 minutes to read The Patriots secured their first win of the 2025 season on Sunday with an eventful matchup against the Dolphins, with New England ultimately holding on for a 33-27 win.

title: Years in the making, Quincy’s new MBTA parking garage opens Monday
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Transportation The parking garage will replace the original surface-level parking lot at the station after six years of construction, according to the MBTA.
The North Quincy MBTA station, which provides Red Line and bus service, will open its new parking garage Monday.

Lane Turner/The Boston Globe By Darin Zullo September 14, 2025 | 11:45 AM 1 minute to read After six years of construction, a new parking garage at the North Quincy MBTA station is finally opening Monday, according to The Patriot Ledger.

title: N.H. leads 25 states in seeking Supreme Court review of ‘unconstitutional’ Mass. gun law
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The effort calls into question whether or not Massachusetts’ firearm regulations for out-of-state visitors are unconstitutional.
The attorneys general of 25 Republican-led states say that Massachusetts' gun regulations pose a constitutional problem.
Joe Raedle/Getty Images By Darin Zullo September 14, 2025 | 11:16 AM 3 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Dua Lipa loved this North End restaurant so much she went there twice
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Food The award-winning pop star enjoyed some of the North End’s crown jewels during some downtime in Boston while on tour.
Dua Lipa performs at TD Garden Sept.
9 on her "Radical Optimism" tour.

title: 2025 Emmys predictions: Who will win, who will get snubbed
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: The Queue This year's Emmys promises to award plenty of worthy winners, with major wins for “Severance,” “Adolescence,” and “The Studio” all but assured.
From left: Leah Lewis and Kathy Bates in "Matlock.
" Sonja Flemming By Kevin Slane September 14, 2025 | 9:00 AM 4 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Alex Bregman shares his advice for younger Red Sox teammates down the stretch
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Red Sox "You could start swinging harder, trying to do more .
Sometimes less is more.
" Alex Bregman hit his first home run in over a month on Saturday.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s 1-1 draw vs. Toronto FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution "There have been too many of those games this year where we're right there to win — especially at home — we've got to go and win it.
" Allan Oyirwoth during his first career MLS start in the Revolution's 1-1 draw vs.
Toronto FC.
